thread.title: Manchester United defender Daley Blind set for summer exit as boss Jose Mourinho eyes Benfica’s Victor Lindelof as replacement
thread.title_full: Manchester United defender Daley Blind set for summer exit as boss Jose Mourinho eyes Benfica’s Victor Lindelof as replacement

author: jhutchinson
title: Manchester United defender Daley Blind set for summer exit as boss Jose Mourinho eyes Benfica’s Victor Lindelof as replacement
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments DALEY BLIND is set to be the first high-profile casualty of Jose Mourinho’s summer clear-out at Manchester United. 
The 26-year-old defender – who has been watched by Arsenal in the past – has a contract at Old Trafford until 2018. PA:Press Association 3 Daley Blind could be on his way out of Old Trafford in the summer after falling out of favour under boss Jose Mourinho 
But United are in no rush to extend his deal, and are looking to offload him quickly this summer. 
Keep up to date with ALL the MANCHESTER UNITED news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Holland international is understood to be “running out of time” to impress Mourinho as he looks to axe some of his squad. Getty Images Jose Mourinho has earmarked Benfica defender Victor Lindelof for a big-money summer move Related Stories In for the Kyl Everything you need to know about Monaco's Kylian Mbappe... who is dubbed the 'next Thierry Henry' Emptyhad Fans mock Manchester City's dreadful attendance for the Champions League clash with Monaco EURO CLASH LIVE - City 1 Monaco 2: Radamel Falcao and Kylian Mbappe double blow stuns Etihad while Atletico lead Leverkusen Preview What time does Bayer Leverkusen vs Atletico Madrid in the Champions League kick off and what TV channel is it on? Bonbed-out Leonardo Bonucci dropped for Juventus' Champions League clash following bust-up with boss Max Allegri Preview Manchester City vs Monaco: When is the Champions League tie and what TV channel is it on? 'go back to Brazil' Vice-president of Serbian team who racially abused Partizan star Everton Luiz launches shocking Facebook rant over 'fake tears' EUROPA LIVE St Etienne vs Manchester United LIVE: Follow all the action, updates and team news from the Europa League round of 32 clash We're rank outsiders Uefa's new rankings have been released - and Chelsea are the only English club in the top ten Team news Manchester City vs Monaco team news: Vincent Kompany OUT, Pep Guardiola still to decide Claudio Bravo or Willy Caballero KLOPP REVOLUTION Liverpool set to transform Kirkby training academy facility with £50m revamp to help find next Steven Gerrard 
A United source said: “Blind is one of the men set to go early this summer. He has a while left on his deal. 
“There are no plans to give him a new contract though. He’s running out of time to impress the boss. 
“He has been very versatile for the club and a good servant, but Jose thinks he has better options now.” 
Blind was signed by Louis van Gaal in 2014 from Ajax for £13.8m, and has been used in a number of positions across the back four. 
But Mourinho now believes he has better quality in defence and plans to add to his options by signing Victor Lindelof from Benfica this summer. 
The Ajax academy youth product has 29 appearances this season, and would have clubs from Italy swarming for his signature. Manchester United's Daley Blind stars in adidas ad that mocks his good looks! Reuters 3 Jose Mourinho will no doubt make further additions to his playing staff at Old Trafford in the summer 
United plan to spend big this summer and would use any transfer fees acquired to help sign Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann for £80m. 
He is also on around £130,000-a-week which would help free-up a large chunk of wages. 
Former Groningen ace Blind has made 75 appearances for Manchester United and scored four goals.
